item.title: Machine Learning Attack Series: Backdooring Keras Model Files
item.description:
Adversaries frequently leverage supply chain attacks to gain a foothold. When it comes to machine learning we discussed model deserialization issues with Python Pickle files in the past which allows an adversary to run code when a model is loaded and used. In this post we will cover TensorFlow (specifically Keras) and backdoor the original Husky AI model from our Machine Learning Attack Series - Overview.
The technique described is based on this post by Microsoft, named Abusing ML model file formats to create malware on AI systems.
